column1: For the 2020 data a correction factor was implemented to correct for the ‘smoothing effect’ caused by the method. The smoothing effect smoothes out yearly variation in the data and this results in a distorted picture of periods of time when mobility patterns suddenly change drastically
column2: like happened in 2020 due to COVID-19. Information on the smoothing effect can be found in the methodological description (only available in Dutch).

column1: From 2016 up the kilometres driven by busses are no longer devided in kilometres driven on Dutch or on foreign roads.

When will new figures be published?
New figures are expected to be released by end of 2022.

column1: 3. LINKS TO RELEVANT TABLES AND ARTICLES

Methods for calculating the emission of transport in the Netherlands.
More information can be found in the theme Verkeer en vervoer (only in Dutch available).

column1: A018940;"Bus";"Passenger road motor vehicle designed to seat more than nine persons (including the driver).
